name: AzureDevTestLabsCreateCustomImage
friendlyName: Azure DevTest Labs Create Custom Image
description: Create an Azure DevTest Labs Custom Image
helpMarkDown: Creates a custom image in the selected lab.
author: Microsoft Corporation
instanceNameFormat: Create Azure DevTest Labs Custom Image
releaseNotes: Works with cross-platform agents (Linux, macOS, or Windows)

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure RM Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure Resource Manager subscription to configure before running.

inputs.name: LabId
inputs.label: Lab
inputs.helpMarkDown: Lab in which the resource will be created. This is a pick list generated as a result of selecting a subscription. Selecting a name from the list will extract the corresponding Lab ID. The Lab ID is a value in the form `/subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}/providers/Microsoft.DevTestLab/labs/{labName}`. Variables in the form `$(varName)` are allowed.

inputs.name: NewCustomImageName
inputs.label: Custom Image Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the custom image that will be created. You can use any variable such as `$(Build.BuildNumber)` or `$(Release.ReleaseName)` when in a build or a release, respectively.

inputs.name: Description
inputs.label: Description
inputs.helpMarkDown: Description of the custom image that will be created. If left blank, an auto-generated string will be used as the description.

inputs.name: LabVmId
inputs.label: Source Lab VM
inputs.helpMarkDown: Source Lab VM from which the resource will be created. The source lab VM must be in the selected lab, as the custom image will be created using its VHD file. Selecting a name from the list will extract the corresponding Lab VM ID. The Lab VM ID is a value in the form `/subscriptions/{subId}/resourceGroups/{rgName}/providers/Microsoft.DevTestLab/labs/{labName}/virtualMachines/{vmName}`. Variables in the form `$(varName)` are allowed. For example, you can use any variable such as `$(labVmId)`, the output of calling **Create Azure DevTest Labs VM**.

inputs.name: OsType
inputs.label: OS Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Type of operating system of the source lab VM. This is a pick list whose allowed values are _Linux_ or _Windows_.

inputs.name: LinuxOsState
inputs.label: Linux OS State
inputs.helpMarkDown: Value indicating how to prepare the source lab VM for custom image creation. This is a pick list whose allowed values are _NonDeprovisioned_, _DeprovisionRequested_ or _DeprovisionApplied_. See [Deprovisioning](http://aka.ms/Deprovisioning) for more information.

inputs.name: WindowsOsState
inputs.label: Windows OS State
inputs.helpMarkDown: Value indicating how to prepare the the source lab VM for custom image creation. This is a pick list whose allowed values are _NonSysprepped_, _SysprepRequested_ or _SysprepApplied_. See [Sysprep](http://aka.ms/Sysprep) for more information.

outputVariables.name: customImageId
outputVariables.description: Capture the created custom image ID.
